topics.title: What is React?
content: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces.
It is maintained by Meta (formerly Facebook) and a large community.
React follows a component-based architecture, making UI development modular and reusable.
It uses a Virtual DOM to improve performance and optimize rendering.

example.description: This function component returns a button element.

topics.title: Why use React?
content: React allows developers to build interactive UIs efficiently.
It uses a declarative approach, making the code more predictable and easier to debug.
React's component-based structure promotes code reusability.
React has strong community support and is widely adopted in the industry.

example.description: This is a simple JSX example that renders an H1 element.

topics.title: Key Features of React
content: Component-Based Architecture: UI is built using reusable components.
Virtual DOM: Enhances performance by minimizing direct DOM manipulation.
One-Way Data Binding: Data flows in a single direction, making state management easier.
Declarative UI: Automatically updates the UI when state changes.
React Hooks: Enables state and lifecycle features in functional components.

topics.title: Basic Example: React Component
content: React components are JavaScript functions that return UI elements.
Components can be functional or class-based.

example.description: A simple React functional component that displays a welcome message.

topics.title: React vs Other Frontend Frameworks
content: React is a library, while Angular and Vue are full-fledged frameworks.
React uses a Virtual DOM for efficient rendering, while Angular and Vue use different strategies.
React follows a unidirectional data flow, making state management more predictable.
